pageContext.claim: “The Supreme Court gave them more time, more time. So what is -- does this mean, does this mean we go, do we wait -- so it's not November 3rd, it's going to be much later than that? No. No. We should know the result of the election on November 3rd -- the evening of November 3rd. That's the way it's been, and that's the way it should be.”
pageContext.analysis: There is no legal requirement that mandates the immediate reporting of all election results in the country; delayed counting is unavoidable when so many people are avoiding election lines during the pandemic. Plenty of presidential elections have remained unsettled on election night, some for days or weeks.
